speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Okay, so I'll explain a little bit how the tools work and then what it will be like as we work together this morning, okay?

dialogue: Can you see it?

dialogue: Yeah.

dialogue: All right, we're going to practice a couple of the tools there that you'll use so you know how to use them.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: The third button down is a pencil, and when you click on it, a color and size box pops up here.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: If you'd like to change the color or size of anything that you're drawing.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: And then there is a square with a T, and that's if you want to type instead of draw anything.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: And then we're going to practice erasing.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: So there you go, cool.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: So you inserted a text box.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Now to erase just one thing, you can use the top arrow to select what it is you want to erase and then hit the backspace or delete button on your keyboard.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Perfect.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Do not hit the trashcan button.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: If you hit it, everything will be gone and we don't have a way to recover it.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Makes sense?

speaker: Student
dialogue: Yeah.

dialogue: Okay, you can close your chat box because we're just going to be talking back and forth like this and it'll make your workspace a little bit bigger.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: And as we're working, I'm going to ask you a lot of questions.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: It doesn't mean that you have something wrong.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: It just means I want to know more about your thinking or push your thinking to go a little bit deeper or a little bit further.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Okay?

speaker: Student
dialogue: Okay.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: And then if I ask you something, because I can't see your face, I can't read your body language.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: And so if you need more time to think about something, you're like, oh, I'm not sure, or I don't know, I want some more time.

speaker: Tutor
dialogue: Just say that out loud so that I don't interrupt your thinking by continuing to talk.

dialogue: Okay, thank you.

dialogue: All right.
